column5: What a beautiful day!   Steve, Sonny, and Fred   Sonny   Raffle Prizes to raise Money For Sick Kids  We started the day at 5:30 am at Timmys of course... then off to Fishmaster Bait and tackle to pick up the rental hut and minnows... on the ice by 6:45.  In time to see the sun rise... absolutely gorgeous of course.  Kick off was at 7:00am, after trying for quiet some time to put our own holes in the ice, (cousin needs to sharpen the blades on his auger), Fishmaster was kind enough to come out with his power auger and get us set up.  I would guess there were between 50-80 ppl at this tournament, scattered from the dam to the mouth of the river.  Early morning a 4+ pound walleye was weighed in and then only two other fish the entire day plus one crappie.  All in all even though we didn't catch anything, my brother (Sonny) cousin and I all had an awesome day.  After being on the ice the warmth found at the Dunnville Hunter and Anglers Club was much enjoyed as was the excellent company and good times.  Sonny managed to walk away with the raffle prizes his heart desired. Even though there were no fish caught we all truly enjoyed our day.  Kudos to Fishmaster for putting on an excellent event! Thanks for all the help today!  Nice meeting everyone  Cheers, Jen
Thanks for the report on a worthwhile cause. Kudos to Fishmaster!
Thanks for the update....Glad you had a good time
Great report Jen,  Thanks very much!  I've been waiting to hear how the day went.  I ended up having to work this morning after all.
well done guys,and like you said everyone had fun and you even won sme goodies in the draw,too bad you didnt catch any fish to enter,theres always next year thanks for the update and pics.....cheers
Nice report, looked like another successful ice fishing event.
Hey Jen,  Glad to hear you had a great day! a day on the water is better then a day not on it!   Gerritt.
Great report Jen.  Looks like it was a successful fundraiser and get together.  Joey
Congrats on the tourney Steve. Sounds like a pretty good turn out.  Thanks for the report Jen.  Mike
Very worthwhile cause...and looked like a great day!  Thanks for sharing.

Well i would like to Thank all that joined in the tourney and thanks all our sponsors for maken this Fund raiser a great day . fishing was tough today with NE winds but there was some nice fish weighed in by a few fellows ..Jamze Houtby was the top winner today taken 1st & 2nd cash Prize with a 3.92 lbs & a 4.68 winning $585 . Guy Chow 3rd place  2.13 $120 cash ..Germy Crumb with the Biggest Crappie .32  won a $25 Gift Certificate. Back at the Dunville Hunters & Anglers Club were the prize and Fund Rasier took place we raised $614 for Sick Kids Hospital & $120 for the Dunnville Hunters & Angler Walleye Stocking .we also handed out some great prizes Guy Chow walked away with a Eskimo Fish Hut . Bowen Sandercock walked away with a nice Strike Master Ice Auger and Santios Amalif with a nice VHF Radio as also many other pepole won some great prizes... Next year i will be planning this derby months ahead of time trying to make this Fund Raiser much more bigger ICE OR NO ICE ...thanks again to all our supporter's and thanks Dunnville Hunters & Aglers for letting us use your Hall for this event ..
Thanks for the reports, glad the event went well...
Thanks for all your support ...hope to see lots of OFC guys and gals and your children down for this fund raiser next winter 2008..Fishmaster Bait & Tackle
